author: Staff Reporter
text:
Members of Communist Party of India (Marxist) staged a demonstration urging Nagercoil Municipality to speed up underground drainage work in Nagercoil on Friday.

The Communist Party of India (Marxist) has urged the municipal authorities to expeditiously complete underground drainage (UGD) work in Nagercoil.

Condemning the undue delay in the UGD work, the cadres of the CPI (M) staged a demonstration in front of Sir C.V. Ramasamy Iyer Memorial Park at Veppamudu junction here on Friday, raising slogans against the municipality.

Addressing the demonstrators, party area secretary Meenakshi Sundaram urged the local body to speed up the UGD work and relay the roads dug up for the project on a war footing. S. Noor Mohemed, State executive committee member, inaugurated the demonstration. District committee members S. Antony and Sagaya Antony, among others spoke.

MDMK demo

Cadres of Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam staged a demonstration in front of the Collectorate, pressing for the same demand.
title: “Complete UGD work quickly”
